ground_truth: Morgan's throat is closing, his face is filled with strain and panic, while Merrill stares at his brother's desperate face. Graham closes his eyes, talks to the darkness, and Merrill's eyes fill up with water as Graham's eyes close, then open as he leans in close to Morgan's ear, after which Graham's eyes close again. He starts crying and speaks to no one, nods without looking over as the beam points up at the basement ceiling above, and Graham stares at the conviction in his younger brother's expression. Graham looks at Morgan lying limp on the ground, turns to Merrill, and the two men stand under the single dangling light bulb. Graham quietly turns and looks at Morgan, moves across the room towards him, and Merrill watches as Graham kneels down and reaches to Morgan's side. Graham unclips the baby monitor from his son's belt, walks back to Merrill, makes eye contact with Merrill, and holds it out between them, then turns it on, resulting in electrical static. The basement door cracks open a few inches, Merrill opens it all the way, moves up the stairs by himself, reaches the top and looks around, turns back down to the faces at the bottom, and gives them the thumbs up. He carries a limp Morgan in his arms, and Merrill nods as he begins to search the piles of things that have fallen from the cabinets, while Graham gently lays Morgan on the sofa. Bo steps out of the closet and looks into the family room, and Graham glances down, then looks up quickly, touches her cheek, and she starts crying. Colleen presses her cheek on top of Graham's hand, rests on it, with her eyes distant while Graham's eyes are not on Merrill. Merrill turns and looks to Graham, follows his eye line to the baseball bat mounted above him, and reaches up to take the bat off its resting place as the creature starts to move. Merrill's hands tighten around the handle as he walks forward, stops, shifts his weight to his right leg while Morgan's face is obscured by gas, and the creature begins to turn and becomes more visible as its lines and colors don't match in position in the room. Merrill's left leg goes out, the creature gets hammered across the back with the baseball bat, Morgan is dropped, falling to the carpet of the family room in an unnatural crumpled pile, with his arms and legs flopping lifelessly to the carpet. The creature turns to face Merrill and all the creature sees is the blur of wood as Merrill swings like a lumberjack, resulting in a slam and the creature falling to the ground. Graham picks up his son's limp body in his arms as the creature moves to its feet.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: Morgan's esophagus is constricting, his visage is filled with tension and terror, while Merrill gazes at his sibling's frantic countenance. Graham shuts his eyes, speaks to the void, and Merrill's eyes brim with moisture as Graham's eyes close, then open as he leans in near to Morgan's ear, after which Graham's eyes close again. He begins weeping and converses with no one, nods without glancing over as the beam directs up at the cellar ceiling above, and Graham gazes at the assurance in his junior sibling's expression. Graham observes Morgan lying inert on the floor, turns to Merrill, and the pair stand under the solitary dangling light bulb. Graham quietly turns and gazes at Morgan, moves across the chamber towards him, and Merrill watches as Graham kneels down and extends to Morgan's side. Graham detaches the baby monitor from his offspring's belt, walks back to Merrill, makes eye contact with Merrill, and holds it out between them, then activates it, resulting in electrical interference. The cellar door cracks open a few inches, Merrill opens it completely, ascends the stairs by himself, reaches the top and surveys the area, turns back down to the visages at the bottom, and gives them the thumbs up. He carries a limp Morgan in his arms, and Merrill nods as he begins to search the piles of objects that have tumbled from the cupboards, while Graham gently lays Morgan on the sofa. Bo emerges from the closet and looks into the family room, and Graham glances downward, then looks up swiftly, touches her cheek, and she starts crying. Colleen presses her cheek on top of Graham's hand, rests on it, with her eyes distant while Graham's eyes are not on Merrill. Merrill turns and looks to Graham, follows his gaze line to the baseball bat mounted above him, and reaches up to take the bat off its resting place as the entity starts to move. Merrill's hands tighten around the handle as he walks forward, halts, shifts his weight to his right leg while Morgan's face is obscured by vapor, and the entity begins to turn and becomes more discernible as its lines and colors don't match in position in the chamber. Merrill's left leg extends out, the entity gets struck across the back with the baseball bat, Morgan is dropped, falling to the carpet of the family room in an unnatural crumpled mass, with his arms and legs flopping lifelessly to the carpet. The entity turns to face Merrill and all the creature sees is the blur of wood as Merrill swings like a lumberjack, resulting in a slam and the entity collapsing to the ground. Graham lifts his offspring's limp form in his arms as the creature moves to its feet.

test_cases.name: Active <-> Passive Transformation
test_cases.description: Morgan's throat is being closed, and his face is filled with strain and panic, while his brother's desperate face is stared at by Merrill. Graham's eyes are closed by him, the darkness is talked to, and Merrill's eyes fill up with water as Graham's eyes are opened by him, then closed again as Morgan's ear is leaned into by him. Crying is started by him, speaking to no one is done by him, nodding is performed without looking over as the beam is pointed up at the basement ceiling above, and the conviction in his younger brother's expression is stared at by Graham. Morgan is looked at by Graham, lying limp on the ground, Merrill is turned to, and the single dangling light bulb is stood under by the two men. Morgan is quietly looked at by Graham, and movement is made across the room towards him by Graham, as he is watched by Merrill. Graham kneels down, reaching to Morgan's side. The baby monitor is unclipped from his son's belt by Graham, and walking back to Merrill is done by Graham, eye contact is made with Merrill, and it is held out between them, then it is turned on, resulting in electrical static. The basement door is cracked open a few inches, and it is opened all the way by Merrill, moving up the stairs by himself, reaching the top and looking around, then turning back down to the faces at the bottom, giving them the thumbs up. A limp Morgan is carried in his arms by him, and the nodding is done by Merrill as the piles of things that have fallen from the cabinets begin to be searched, while Morgan is gently laid on the sofa by Graham. Bo steps out of the closet and looks into the family room, and down is glanced at by Graham, then up quickly, her cheek is touched, and crying is started by her. On top of Graham's hand, Colleen presses her cheek, resting on it, with her eyes distant while eyes are not on Merrill by Graham. Graham is looked at by Merrill, his eye line is followed to the baseball bat mounted above him, and reaching up is done to take the bat off its resting place as the creature starts to move. The handle is tightened around by Merrill's hands as he walks forward, stopping, weight is shifted to his right leg while Morgan's face is obscured by gas, and the creature's turning is begun and becoming more visible as its lines and colors don't match in position in the room. Merrill's left leg goes out, and the creature is hammered across the back with the baseball bat, Morgan is dropped, falling to the carpet of the family room in an unnatural crumpled pile, with his arms and legs flopping lifelessly to the carpet. Merrill is faced by the creature, and all the creature sees is the blur of wood as a swing is performed by Merrill like a lumberjack, resulting in a slam and the creature falling to the ground. His son's limp body is picked up in his arms by Graham, as its feet are moved to by the creature.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: Morgan's throat is closing, his face strained and panicked, while Merrill watches his brother. Graham closes his eyes, speaks to the darkness, and Merrill's eyes fill with tears. Graham leans close to Morgan's ear, then cries and nods as the beam points at the basement ceiling. Graham looks at Morgan on the ground, turns to Merrill, and they stand under a single light bulb. Graham moves to Morgan, unclips the baby monitor from his son's belt, and hands it to Merrill, turning it on to hear static. The basement door opens slightly, Merrill goes upstairs, looks around, and signals it's safe. He carries Morgan, while Merrill searches through fallen items, and Graham lays Morgan on the sofa. Bo emerges from the closet, and Graham comforts her. Colleen rests her cheek on Graham's hand, eyes distant. Merrill looks at Graham, follows his gaze to a baseball bat, and takes it as the creature moves. Merrill grips the bat, shifts his weight, and strikes the creature, causing Morgan to fall limply to the carpet. The creature turns to Merrill, who swings the bat, knocking it down. Graham lifts his son's limp body as the creature rises.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: Morgan's throat closes, his face strained and panicked, while Merrill watches. Graham closes his eyes, speaks to the darkness, and Merrill's eyes fill with tears. Graham leans to Morgan's ear, cries, and nods as the beam points at the ceiling. Graham looks at Morgan on the ground, turns to Merrill, and they stand under a single light bulb. Graham moves to Morgan, unclips the baby monitor from his son's belt, returns to Merrill, makes eye contact, and turns it on, causing static. The basement door opens slightly, Merrill opens it fully, ascends alone, looks around, and gives a thumbs up. He carries Morgan, and Merrill searches fallen items while Graham lays Morgan on the sofa. Bo exits the closet, Graham touches her cheek, and she cries. Colleen rests her cheek on Graham's hand, eyes distant. Merrill follows Graham's gaze to a baseball bat, takes it as the creature moves. Merrill grips the bat, shifts his weight, and the creature becomes visible. Merrill strikes the creature, dropping Morgan to the carpet. The creature faces Merrill, sees a blur of wood, and falls. Graham lifts his son as the creature rises.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description: Morgan's throat feels as though it is closing up, and his face is filled with a mixture of strain and panic, while Merrill stands there, staring intently at his brother's desperate expression. Graham, in a moment of introspection, closes his eyes and speaks softly to the enveloping darkness. Meanwhile, Merrill's eyes begin to fill with tears as he watches Graham's eyes close, then open again as he leans in close to Morgan's ear, only to close once more. Overcome with emotion, Graham starts to cry and speaks to no one in particular, nodding without looking over as the beam of light points upward at the basement ceiling above. Graham's gaze is fixed on the conviction in his younger brother's expression. He looks down at Morgan, who is lying limp on the ground, then turns to face Merrill, and together, the two men stand under the single, dimly lit, dangling light bulb. Graham quietly turns his attention back to Morgan, moving across the room towards him, while Merrill watches intently as Graham kneels down and reaches to Morgan's side. With a gentle motion, Graham unclips the baby monitor from his son's belt, walks back to Merrill, makes eye contact with him, and holds it out between them, then turns it on, resulting in a crackling sound of electrical static. The basement door creaks open a few inches, and Merrill opens it all the way, moving up the stairs by himself. He reaches the top, looks around cautiously, then turns back down to the faces at the bottom of the stairs and gives them a reassuring thumbs up. He carries a limp Morgan in his arms, and Merrill nods in acknowledgment as he begins to search through the piles of things that have fallen from the cabinets, while Graham gently lays Morgan down on the sofa. Bo steps out of the closet and looks into the family room, and Graham glances down momentarily, then quickly looks up, tenderly touches her cheek, and she starts to cry. Colleen presses her cheek on top of Graham's hand, resting on it, her eyes distant and unfocused, while Graham's eyes are not on Merrill. Merrill turns his head to look at Graham, follows his eye line to the baseball bat mounted above him, and reaches up to take the bat off its resting place just as the creature starts to move. Merrill's hands tighten around the handle as he walks forward, stops, and shifts his weight to his right leg while Morgan's face is obscured by gas. The creature begins to turn and becomes more visible as its lines and colors don't match in position in the room. Merrill's left leg extends out, and the creature gets hammered across the back with the baseball bat. Morgan is dropped, falling to the carpet of the family room in an unnatural, crumpled pile, with his arms and legs flopping lifelessly to the carpet. The creature turns to face Merrill, and all it sees is the blur of wood as Merrill swings with the force of a lumberjack, resulting in a resounding slam and the creature falling to the ground. Graham quickly picks up his son's limp body in his arms as the creature begins to move to its feet once more.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description: Morgan is experiencing a sensation as if his throat is tightening, and the expression on his face is a complex blend of strain and unmistakable panic. Meanwhile, Merrill stands in place, his gaze fixed intently on the desperate expression displayed by his brother. In a moment of quiet introspection, Graham closes his eyes and begins to speak softly into the enveloping darkness around him. At this same moment, Merrill finds his own eyes filling with tears, watching as Graham’s eyes first close, then slowly open again. Graham leans in close to Morgan's ear, only to shut his eyes once more. Overcome by a flood of emotion, Graham starts to cry and speaks aloud to no one in particular, nodding as if he is in agreement with something unseen, without directing his gaze. The beam of light from the flashlight points upward, illuminating the basement ceiling above them. Graham’s gaze is steadfastly focused on the unwavering conviction he sees in his younger brother's expression. He then glances down at Morgan, who lies limp on the ground, turning to face Merrill. Together, the two men stand under the single, dimly lit, dangling light bulb that casts a faint glow around them. Graham then quietly shifts his attention back to Morgan, slowly making his way across the room towards him. Merrill continues to watch intently as Graham kneels down by Morgan's side. With a gentle and deliberate motion, Graham unclips the baby monitor from where it is secured on his son's belt. He then walks back to where Merrill is standing, meets his eyes, and holds the monitor out between them, turning it on and causing a crackling sound of electrical static to fill the air. The basement door creaks open just a few inches, and Merrill proceeds to open it fully, ascending the stairs alone. Upon reaching the top, he looks around cautiously, then turns back to the others waiting below, offering them a reassuring thumbs-up gesture. He then carries the limp form of Morgan in his arms. Merrill nods in acknowledgment, beginning to rummage through the piles of items that have fallen from the cabinets. Meanwhile, Graham gently lays Morgan down on the sofa. Bo emerges from the closet, steps into the family room, and Graham, glancing down momentarily, quickly looks up to tenderly touch her cheek, prompting her to start crying. Colleen presses her cheek against the top of Graham's hand, which rests there, her eyes distant and unfocused, while Graham’s gaze is not directed at Merrill. Merrill turns his head, looking at Graham, then follows his gaze to the baseball bat mounted above him. He reaches up, taking the bat off its resting place, just as the creature starts to move. Merrill’s hands grip the handle tightly as he walks forward, stops, and shifts his weight onto his right leg as Morgan’s face is obscured by something like gas. The creature starts to turn, becoming more visible as its lines and colors don’t quite align with the room’s features. Merrill extends his left leg forward, and the creature is struck across the back with the baseball bat. Morgan is dropped, tumbling to the carpet of the family room in an awkward, crumpled pile, his arms and legs flopping lifelessly onto the carpet. The creature turns to face Merrill, and all it perceives is a blur of wood as Merrill swings the bat with the force of a seasoned lumberjack, resulting in a resounding slam as the creature falls to the ground. Quickly, Graham picks up his son's limp body in his arms as the creature begins its attempt to rise to its feet once more.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: Morgan's throat begins to constrict, causing his face to contort with strain and panic, while Merrill stands by, fixated on his brother's desperate expression. Graham, in a moment of introspection, closes his eyes and speaks softly to the enveloping darkness. As he does so, Merrill's eyes well up with tears, mirroring the emotional weight of the moment. Graham's eyes flutter open, and he leans in close to Morgan's ear, whispering something inaudible before closing his eyes once more. Overcome with emotion, he starts to cry, speaking to no one in particular, and nods absentmindedly as a beam of light points upward at the basement ceiling. Graham's gaze shifts to Morgan, who lies limp on the ground, and then to Merrill, as the two men stand together under the solitary, dangling light bulb. Graham quietly turns his attention back to Morgan, moving deliberately across the room towards him, while Merrill watches intently. Graham kneels down beside Morgan, reaching to his side to unclip the baby monitor from his son's belt. He then walks back to Merrill, making direct eye contact, and extends the monitor between them before switching it on, filling the air with the sound of electrical static. The basement door creaks open slightly, prompting Merrill to open it fully. He ascends the stairs alone, reaching the top, where he surveys the surroundings before turning back to the faces below and signaling a thumbs up. Graham carefully lifts Morgan's limp body into his arms, while Merrill nods in acknowledgment and begins to sift through the piles of items that have tumbled from the cabinets. Graham gently places Morgan on the sofa, and Bo emerges from the closet, peering into the family room. Graham glances down momentarily, then quickly looks up, tenderly touching Bo's cheek, which prompts her to start crying. Colleen presses her cheek against the top of Graham's hand, resting there with a distant look in her eyes, while Graham's focus is elsewhere, not on Merrill. Merrill turns his attention to Graham, following his gaze to the baseball bat mounted above him. He reaches up, taking the bat from its resting place just as the creature begins to stir. Merrill's grip tightens around the handle as he advances, stopping momentarily to shift his weight onto his right leg. Meanwhile, Morgan's face is obscured by gas, and the creature becomes more visible, its lines and colors misaligned with the room's position. Merrill extends his left leg, and with a powerful swing, he hammers the creature across the back with the baseball bat. Morgan is released, falling to the carpet of the family room in an unnatural, crumpled heap, his arms and legs flopping lifelessly. The creature turns to face Merrill, but all it perceives is the blur of wood as Merrill swings with the force of a lumberjack, delivering a resounding blow that sends the creature crashing to the ground. In the midst of the chaos, Graham scoops up his son's limp body in his arms, even as the creature struggles to its feet once more.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: Morgan struggles to breathe, his face showing panic, while Merrill watches him intently. Graham closes his eyes, speaks softly, and then leans close to Morgan, his emotions evident. As Graham cries and speaks to the darkness, he nods without looking up, while the beam of light points to the ceiling. Observing Merrill's determined expression, Graham turns to him, and they stand together under the dim light. Graham approaches Morgan, kneels beside him, and removes the baby monitor from his son's belt. He returns to Merrill, makes eye contact, and turns on the monitor, producing static. The basement door opens slightly, and Merrill ascends the stairs alone, checks the surroundings, and signals the all-clear with a thumbs up. He carries Morgan, while Graham gently places him on the sofa. Bo emerges from the closet, and Graham comforts her as she cries. Colleen rests her cheek on Graham's hand, lost in thought, while Graham's focus shifts to Merrill. Following Graham's gaze, Merrill retrieves a baseball bat from the wall as a creature begins to move. Merrill grips the bat tightly, advances, and strikes the creature, causing Morgan to fall to the floor. The creature turns to face Merrill, who swings the bat forcefully, knocking it down. Graham then lifts his son's limp body as the creature attempts to rise again.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: Morgan's throat is closing, a symptom likely indicating an asthma attack, his face filled with strain and panic, while Merrill stares at his brother's desperate face. Graham, their older brother often seen as the family leader, closes his eyes, talks to the darkness in an apparent attempt to summon courage, and Merrill's eyes fill up with water as Graham's eyes close, then open as he leans in close to Morgan's ear to offer reassurance, after which Graham's eyes close again. He starts crying and speaks to no one, nods without looking over as the beam of their only flashlight points up at the basement ceiling above, and Graham stares at the conviction in his younger brother's expression, recalling how Merrill used to play baseball in college. Graham looks at Morgan lying limp on the ground, turns to Merrill, and the two men stand under the single dangling light bulb, reminiscent of old basements designed as storm shelters. Graham quietly turns and looks at Morgan, moves across the room towards him, and Merrill watches as Graham kneels down and reaches to Morgan's side with determination. Graham unclips the baby monitor from his son's belt, a tool they have used to keep track of the children's safety during the crisis, walks back to Merrill, makes eye contact with Merrill, and holds it out between them, then turns it on, resulting in electrical static indicating interference with its ordinary functionality. The basement door cracks open a few inches, sensitive to drafts, Merrill opens it all the way, moves up the stairs by himself, reaches the top and looks around the farmhouse's familiar layout, turns back down to the faces at the bottom, and gives them the thumbs up, a gesture of cautious reassurance. He carries a limp Morgan in his arms, and Merrill nods as he begins to search the piles of things that have fallen from the cabinets, while Graham gently lays Morgan on the sofa, which is worn from years of family use. Bo, the youngest sibling known for her perceptive nature, steps out of the closet and looks into the family room, and Graham glances down, then looks up quickly, touches her cheek affectionately, and she starts crying. Colleen, their late mother who often brought calm to the household, presses her cheek on top of Graham's hand, rests on it, with her eyes distant while Graham's eyes are not on Merrill. Merrill turns and looks to Graham, follows his eye line to the baseball bat mounted above him, a relic from his high school sports triumphs, and reaches up to take the bat off its resting place as the creature, an intruder from a recent extraterrestrial event, starts to move. Merrill's hands tighten around the handle as he walks forward, stops, shifts his weight to his right leg while Morgan's face is obscured by gas, an indication of the noxious atmosphere introduced by the alien presence, and the creature begins to turn and becomes more visible as its lines and colors don't match in position in the room, a feature of its camouflage ability. Merrill's left leg goes out, the creature gets hammered across the back with the baseball bat, Morgan is dropped, falling to the carpet of the family room in an unnatural crumpled pile, with his arms and legs flopping lifelessly to the carpet. The creature turns to face Merrill and all the creature sees is the blur of wood as Merrill swings like a lumberjack, a skill inherited from his father's forestry work, resulting in a slam and the creature falling to the ground. Graham picks up his son's limp body in his arms as the creature moves to its feet, determined to protect his family at all costs.

In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. He carries a limp Morgan in his arms and Merrill nods as he begins to search the piles of things that have fallen from the cabinets while Graham gently lays Morgan on the sofa. Bo steps out of the closet and looks into the family room and Graham glances down then looks up quickly touches her cheek and she starts crying. Colleen presses her cheek on top of Graham's hand rests on it with her eyes distant while Graham's eyes are not on Merrill. Merrill turns and looks to. Graham follows his eye line to the baseball bat mounted above him and reaches up to take the bat off its resting place as the creature starts to move Merrill's hands tighten around the handle as he walks forward stops shifts his weight to his right leg while Morgan's face is obscured by gas and the creature begins to turn and becomes more visible as its lines and colors do not match in position in the room. Merrill's left leg goes out. the creature gets hammered across the back with the baseball bat. Morgan is dropped falling to the carpet of the family room in an unnatural crumpled pile with his arms and legs flopping lifelessly to the carpet. The creature turns to face Merrill and all the creature sees is the blur of wood as Merrill swings like a lumberjack resulting in a slam and the creature falling to the ground. Graham picks up his son's limp body in his arms as the creature moves to its feet.

Graham closes his eyes talks to the darkness and Merrill's eyes fill up with water as Graham's eyes close then open as he leans in close to Morgan's ear after which Graham's eyes close again. He starts crying and speaks to no one nods without looking over as the beam points up at the basement ceiling above and Graham stares at the conviction in his younger brother's expression. Graham looks at Morgan lying limp on the ground turns to Merrill and the two men stand under the single dangling light bulb. Graham quietly turns and looks at. Merrill's left leg goes out. the creature gets hammered across the back with the baseball bat. Morgan is dropped falling to the carpet of the family room in an unnatural crumpled pile with his arms and legs flopping lifelessly to the carpet. test_cases.name: Subject Corruption
test_cases.description: Gerald's throat is closing, her face is filled with strain and panic, while Linda stares at her sister's desperate face. Terrence closes his eyes, talks to the darkness, and Linda's eyes fill up with water as Terrence's eyes close, then open as he leans in close to Gerald's ear, after which Terrence's eyes close again. She starts crying and speaks to no one, nods without looking over as the beam points up at the basement ceiling above, and Terrence stares at the conviction in her younger sister's expression. Terrence looks at Gerald lying limp on the ground, turns to Linda, and the two women stand under the single dangling light bulb. Terrence quietly turns and looks at Gerald, moves across the room towards him, and Linda watches as Terrence kneels down and reaches to Gerald's side. Terrence unclips the baby monitor from his daughter's belt, walks back to Linda, makes eye contact with Linda, and holds it out between them, then turns it on, resulting in electrical static. The basement door cracks open a few inches, Linda opens it all the way, moves up the stairs by herself, reaches the top and looks around, turns back down to the faces at the bottom, and gives them the thumbs up. She carries a limp Gerald in her arms, and Linda nods as she begins to search the piles of things that have fallen from the cabinets, while Terrence gently lays Gerald on the sofa. Frank steps out of the closet and looks into the family room, and Terrence glances down, then looks up quickly, touches her cheek, and she starts crying. Barbara presses her cheek on top of Terrence's hand, rests on it, with her eyes distant while Terrence's eyes are not on Linda. Linda turns and looks to Terrence, follows his eye line to the baseball bat mounted above him, and reaches up to take the bat off its resting place as the creature starts to move. Linda's hands tighten around the handle as she walks forward, stops, shifts her weight to her right leg while Gerald's face is obscured by gas, and the creature begins to turn and becomes more visible as its lines and colors don't match in position in the room. Linda's left leg goes out, the creature gets hammered across the back with the baseball bat, Gerald is dropped, falling to the carpet of the family room in an unnatural crumpled pile, with her arms and legs flopping lifelessly to the carpet. The creature turns to face Linda and all the creature sees is the blur of wood as Linda swings like a lumberjack, resulting in a slam and the creature falling to the ground. Terrence picks up his daughter's limp body in his arms as the creature moves to its feet.

test_cases.name: Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Morgan's throat is closing, his face is filled with strain and panic, while Merrill stares at his brother's desperate face. Graham closes his eyes, talks to the shadows, and Merrill's eyes fill up with tears as Graham's eyes close, then open as he leans in close to Morgan's ear, after which Graham's eyes close again. He starts crying and speaks to no one, nods without looking over as the beam points up at the attic ceiling above, and Graham stares at the conviction in his younger brother's expression. Graham looks at Morgan lying limp on the floor, turns to Merrill, and the two men stand under the single dangling lantern. Graham quietly turns and looks at Morgan, moves across the room towards him, and Merrill watches as Graham kneels down and reaches to Morgan's side. Graham unclips the walkie-talkie from his son's belt, walks back to Merrill, makes eye contact with Merrill, and holds it out between them, then turns it on, resulting in electrical static. The attic door cracks open a few inches, Merrill opens it all the way, moves up the ladder by himself, reaches the top and looks around, turns back down to the faces at the bottom, and gives them the thumbs up. He carries a limp Morgan in his arms, and Merrill nods as he begins to search the piles of things that have fallen from the shelves, while Graham gently lays Morgan on the armchair. Bo steps out of the pantry and looks into the living room, and Graham glances down, then looks up quickly, touches her shoulder, and she starts crying. Colleen presses her cheek on top of Graham's hand, rests on it, with her eyes distant while Graham's eyes are not on Merrill. Merrill turns and looks to Graham, follows his eye line to the golf club mounted above him, and reaches up to take the club off its resting place as the creature starts to move. Merrill's hands tighten around the handle as he walks forward, stops, shifts his weight to his right leg while Morgan's face is obscured by fog, and the creature begins to turn and becomes more visible as its lines and colors don't match in position in the room. Merrill's left leg goes out, the creature gets hammered across the back with the golf club, Morgan is dropped, falling to the rug of the living room in an unnatural crumpled pile, with his arms and legs flopping lifelessly to the rug. The creature turns to face Merrill and all the creature sees is the blur of metal as Merrill swings like a gardener, resulting in a slam and the creature falling to the ground. Graham picks up his son's limp body in his arms as the creature moves to its feet.

test_cases.name: Action Corruption
test_cases.description: Morgan's throat is tickling, his face is filled with joy and delight, while Merrill admires his brother's enthusiastic face. Graham opens his eyes, whispers to the shadows, and Merrill's eyes fill up with light as Graham's eyes open, then close as he leans in close to Morgan's ear, after which Graham's eyes open again. He starts laughing and hums to no one, shakes his head without turning around as the beam points down at the basement floor below, and Graham glances at the comfort in his younger brother's expression. Graham observes Morgan sitting upright on the ground, turns to Merrill, and the two men walk under the single dangling light bulb. Graham loudly turns and smiles at Morgan, hops across the room towards him, and Merrill watches as Graham stands up and dances to Morgan's side. Graham attaches the baby monitor to his son's belt, skips back to Merrill, breaks eye contact with Merrill, and holds it down between them, then turns it off, resulting in silence. The basement door swings open a few feet, Merrill closes it halfway, slides down the stairs by himself, reaches the bottom and glances around, turns back up to the faces at the top, and gives them a wave. He drags a lively Morgan in his arms, and Merrill claps as he begins to organize the piles of things that have stacked in the cabinets, while Graham gently lifts Morgan onto the sofa. Bo steps out of the closet and peeks into the family room, and Graham glances up, then looks down quickly, pats her back, and she starts laughing. Colleen presses her cheek on top of Graham's shoulder, leans on it, with her eyes lively while Graham's eyes are not on Merrill. Merrill turns and looks to Graham, follows his eye line to the baseball bat mounted above him, and sits down to take the bat off its resting place as the creature stops moving. Merrill's hands loosen around the handle as he steps backward, stops, shifts his weight to his left leg while Morgan's face is illuminated by light, and the creature begins to stop and becomes less visible as its lines and colors align perfectly in the room. Merrill's right leg goes in, the creature gets brushed gently across the back with the baseball bat, Morgan is lifted, rising to the ceiling of the family room in a graceful floating pose, with his arms and legs spread joyfully to the ceiling. The creature turns away from Merrill and all the creature sees is the blur of feathers as Merrill swings like a conductor, resulting in a tap and the creature rising to the ceiling. Graham lays down his son's energetic body in his arms as the creature settles on its back.

test_cases.name: Subject-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Zephyr's elbow is opening, his car is filled with calm and joy, while Orion gazes at his bicycle's eager wheel. Phoenix opens his windows, listens to the birds, and Orion's windows fill up with rain as Phoenix's windows open, then close as he leans in close to Zephyr's shoe, after which Phoenix's windows open again. He starts laughing and listens to everyone, frowns without glancing over as the radio signals down at the attic floor below, and Phoenix gazes at the confusion in his older bicycle's vision. Phoenix glances at Zephyr standing still on the sky, turns to Orion, and the two cats sit above the double flying kite. Phoenix silently turns and glances at Zephyr, moves across the ocean towards him, and Orion watches as Phoenix stands up and reaches to Zephyr's cloud. Phoenix unfastens the radio transmitter from his dog's collar, walks back to Orion, makes eye contact with Orion, and holds it out among them, then turns it on, resulting in mechanical silence. The attic window creaks open a few feet, Orion closes it all the way, moves down the ladder by herself, reaches the bottom and glances around, turns back up to the wheels at the peak, and gives them the earphones down. She holds a steady Zephyr in her paws, and Orion shakes as she begins to organize the heaps of stars that have risen from the baskets, while Phoenix softly moves Zephyr on the cloud. Echo steps into the garden and glances into the solar system, and Phoenix peeks down, then glances up slowly, feels her hand, and she starts laughing. Andromeda taps her hand on top of Phoenix's forehead, floats on it, with her windows close while Phoenix's windows are on Orion. Orion flips and glances to Phoenix, follows his finger line to the tennis racket draped below her, and reaches down to leave the racket on its sleeping place as the painter stops to pause. Orion's feet loosen around the grip as she skips backward, rests, shifts her weight to her left arm while Zephyr's car is illuminated by stars, and the painter ceases to pause and becomes less visible as its shapes and patterns do match in alignment outside the ocean. Orion's right arm comes in, the painter helps painted along the front with the tennis racket, Zephyr is lifted, jumping to the clouds of the solar system in a natural graceful dance, with his legs and arms stretching energetically to the clouds. The painter pauses to greet Orion and all the painter feels is the echo of sky as Orion waves like a conductor, resulting in a song and the painter floating to the sky. Phoenix gazes at his dog's busy mind in her paws as the painter stops to sit.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action Corruption
test_cases.description: Jonathan's knees are buckling, his eyes are filled with laughter and confusion, while Samuel peers at his friend's joyful eyes. Daniel closes his mouth, whispers to the silence, and Samuel's cheeks fill up with color as Daniel's mouth opens, then closes as he inches closer to Jonathan's shoulder, after which Daniel's mouth opens again. He starts laughing and gestures to everyone, waves without glancing over as the lamp shines down at the basement floor below, and Daniel gazes at the disbelief in his older friend's demeanor. Daniel glances at Jonathan sitting awkwardly on the floor, turns to Samuel, and the two friends chat under the single flickering lantern. Daniel quietly spins and observes Jonathan, strides across the room towards him, and Samuel watches as Daniel bends down and reaches for Jonathan's knee. Daniel removes the walkie-talkie from his friend's pocket, strolls back to Samuel, locks eyes with Samuel, and holds it out between them, then switches it on, resulting in muffled noise. The basement window swings open a few inches, Samuel pushes it all the way, climbs up the ladder by himself, reaches the top and scans the surroundings, turns back down to the figures below, and gives them the peace sign. He drags a tired Jonathan in his arms, and Samuel grins as he begins to organize the scattered objects from the shelves, while Daniel gently places Jonathan on the armchair. Mia steps out of the pantry and peers into the living room, and Daniel glances up, then looks down quickly, pats her head, and she starts laughing. Lola presses her head on top of Daniel's hand, leans on it, with her eyes curious while Daniel's eyes are not on Samuel. Samuel swivels and glances at Daniel, follows his gaze to the cricket bat mounted beside him, and reaches up to remove the bat from its resting place as the apparition begins to twitch. Samuel's fingers grip around the handle as he strides forward, halts, shifts his weight to his left leg while Jonathan's hair is covered by dust, and the apparition starts to rotate and becomes more visible as its shapes and hues don't align in place in the room. Samuel's right leg extends, the apparition gets struck across the shoulder with the cricket bat, Jonathan is released, toppling to the carpet of the living room in an unnatural crumpled pile, with his arms and legs splaying lifelessly to the carpet. The apparition spins to face Samuel and all the apparition perceives is the blur of wood as Samuel swings like a golfer, resulting in a crash and the apparition collapsing to the floor. Daniel lifts his friend's tired frame in his arms as the apparition shifts to its knees.

test_cases.name: Object-Action Corruption
test_cases.description: Morgan's throat is expanding, his face is filled with relaxation and confidence, while Merrill gazes at his brother's serene face. Graham opens his eyes, sings to the brightness, and Merrill's eyes fill up with sand as Graham's eyes open, then close as he leans away from Morgan's ear, after which Graham's eyes open again. He starts laughing and sings to everyone, shakes his head without looking over as the shadow points down at the attic floor below, and Graham gazes at the doubt in his younger brother's expression. Graham looks at Morgan standing firm on the roof, turns to Merrill, and the two men stand over the double hanging chandelier. Graham loudly turns and looks at Morgan, dances across the room away from him, and Merrill watches as Graham jumps up and reaches to Morgan's head. Graham unhooks the toy car from his son's necklace, walks over to Merrill, avoids eye contact with Merrill, and holds it out above them, then tosses it down, resulting in musical notes. The attic door swings open a few feet, Merrill swings it shut, moves down the ladder by himself, reaches the bottom and looks up, turns back up to the faces at the top, and gives them the peace sign. He drags a rigid Morgan by his shoulders, and Merrill shrugs as he begins to hide the piles of things that have risen from the shelves, while Graham gently pulls Morgan off the chair. Bo steps into the hallway and looks into the dining room, and Graham glances up, then looks down quickly, pats her shoulder, and she starts laughing. Colleen taps her shoulder on top of Graham's hand, bounces on it, with her eyes alert while Graham's eyes are not on Merrill. Merrill turns and looks to Graham, follows his eye line to the fishing rod mounted below him, and reaches down to take the rod off its resting place as the creature stops to rest. Merrill's hands loosen around the reel as he jumps backward, resumes, shifts his weight to his left leg while Morgan's face is obscured by steam, and the creature begins to stay and becomes less visible as its lines and colors do match in position in the room. Merrill's right leg goes in, the creature gets tickled across the front with the fishing rod, Morgan is lifted, rising to the ceiling of the dining room in a natural flowing pile, with his arms and legs floating gracefully to the ceiling. The creature turns away from Merrill and all the creature hears is the swish of air as Merrill dances like a ballerina, resulting in a whisper and the creature rising to the ceiling. Graham drops his son's upright body from his arms as the creature rests on its back.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Richard's ankle is expanding, his hand is filled with calm and excitement, while Vivian squints at her sister's thrilled hand. Carter opens his mouth, whispers to the silence, and Vivian's nose fills up with light as Carter's mouth opens, then closes as he leans in close to Richard's knee, after which Carter's mouth opens again. He starts laughing and whispers to everyone, frowns without glancing up as the leaf floats down on the attic floor below, and Carter squints at the doubt in his older sister's movement. Carter glances at Richard sitting tall on the chair, turns to Vivian, and the three women sit beside the double broken candle. Carter loudly turns and glances at Richard, floats towards the wall beside her, and Vivian wonders as Carter hops up and reaches to Richard's foot. Carter clips the radio from his daughter's shoe, skips forward to Vivian, avoids eye contact with Vivian, and hides it away from them, then turns it off, silencing the mechanical calm. The attic window bursts open a few feet, Vivian closes it partway, tumbles down the ladder with everyone else, hits the bottom and wonders away, turns back up to the frames by the top, and gives them the fist bump. She drags a bulky Richard on her back, and Vivian frowns as she begins to ignore the heaps of objects that have risen into the cupboards, while Carter harshly drops Richard on the table. Sam leaps out of the drawer and wanders into the living space, and Carter checks up, then wonders down quickly, brushes his shoulder, and he starts laughing. Oliver stretches his shoulder on top of Carter's foot, dreams with it, with her mouth closed while Carter's nose is on Vivian. Vivian wanders and glances to Carter, precedes his mouth line to the cricket racquet buried below her, and scratches down to remove the racquet from its hidden place as the animal stops to sit. Vivian's toes soften around the string as she runs backward, spins, shifts her height to her left arm while Richard's hand is faded by steam, and the animal starts to halt and becomes less faint as its shapes and shades do align in motion in the window. Vivian's right arm comes in, the animal gets tickled across the chin with the cricket racquet, Richard is caught, floating to the rug of the living space in a typical solid crumbly stack, with her hands and feet rising powerfully to the rug. The animal stops to watch Vivian and all the animal hears is the ring of paper as Vivian strums like a flutist, resulting in a whisper and the animal rising to the ceiling. Carter drops his daughter's bulky leg in her arms as the animal jumps to its hands.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Morgan struggles as his throat closes and Graham, filled with emotion, whispers to him. In a dimly lit basement, Graham takes a baby monitor from Morgan's belt, turning it on to hear static, while Merrill checks upstairs and signals all is clear. Graham lays Morgan on a sofa, comforting Bo with a touch as she cries. Merrill spots a baseball bat on the wall and grabs it as a creature emerges. Moving quickly, Merrill strikes the creature with the bat, causing Morgan to fall lifelessly to the floor. As the creature turns, Merrill delivers a powerful blow, knocking it down. Graham then picks up Morgan's limp body.

cracks open a few inches  Merrill opens it all the way moves up the stairs by himself reaches the top and looks around turns back down to the faces at the bottom and gives them the thumbs up
